column1: Elbow replacement is surgery to replace the elbow joint with artificial joint parts (prosthetics).
The elbow joint connects two bones: - The humerus in the upper arm - The ulna in the lower arm (forearm) The artificial elbow joint has two stems made of high-quality metal.
Some patients may also receive regional anesthesia.
A cut (incision) is made on the back of your elbow so that the surgeon can view your elbow joint.

Some causes of damage are: - Osteoarthritis - Poor outcome from past elbow surgery - Rheumatoid arthritis - Badly broken bone in the upper or lower arm near the elbow - Badly damaged or torn tissues in the elbow - Tumor in or around the elbow - Stiff elbow
These include aspirin, ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin), and naproxen (Naprosyn, Aleve).
Elbow replacement surgery eases pain for most people.
